topic: Socio Religious Reform Movement, Organisations and Personalities

flashcards.back: Dr. Rakhmabai - Legal battle against child marriage led to Age of Consent Act 1891, became one of first female doctors in colonial India
Women of Kuka Community (Punjab) - Actively participated in protests against British rule, providing significant support
Swarnakumari Devi, Sarala Devi Chaudhurani - Key figures in protests against Partition, played important role in Swadeshi movement
Annie Besant led Home Rule League, Margaret Cousins co-founded Women's Indian Association, advocating women's suffrage across Madras
Maharashtra, Gujarat, UP
Annie Besant, Dorothy Jinarajadasa, Margaret Cousins - Founded in Madras, worked towards women's suffrage and social reforms
Kasturba Gandhi, Sarojini Naidu - Instrumental in protesting Rowlatt Act and participating in Satyagraha against repressive British laws
Basanti Debi - First woman to be arrested for movement. Suniti Devi promoted spinning of khadi and boycott of foreign goods in Bengal
Anasuya Sarabhai - Founded Ahmedabad Textile Labour Association, advocating for labour rights and better working conditions for textile workers
Margaret Cousins - Central figure in founding AIWC, promoted women's education, social rights, economic empowerment
Muthulakshmi Reddi - First woman legislator in Chennai's Legislative Council, crucial role advocating for Sharda Act
Sarojini Naidu led Dharasana Salt Works raid, Mithuben Petit prominent participant in Salt Marches
Santi Ghose, Suniti Chaudhuri - Involved in assassination of British district magistrate, marking entry of women into revolutionary activities
Usha Mehta ran secret Congress Radio, Kamaladevi Chattopadhyay arrested for promoting self-reliance through handicrafts and selling contraband salt
Aruna Asaf Ali hoisted Indian flag at Gowalia Tank, Sucheta Kriplani organised protests, Matangini Hazra became martyr
Kasturba Gandhi participated, Parbati Giri provided humanitarian services, Bina Das attempted Governor assassination
Kalyani Das, Bina Das - Played vital roles in famine relief efforts and contributed to fight for India's independence
Rameshwari Nehru, Mridula Sarabhai - Focused on refugee rehabilitation and women's welfare in Partition aftermath
1916: Co-founded Women's Indian Association. 1917: Founded Women's Indian Association in Madras. 1927: Central figure in founding AIWC
1919: Rowlatt Satyagraha. 1927: AIWC founding member. 1930: Led Dharasana Salt Works raid
1916: Led Home Rule League. 1917: Founded Women's Indian Association with Dorothy Jinarajadasa and Margaret Cousins
1919: Rowlatt Satyagraha. 1942: Quit India Movement participation
1942: Attempted Governor of Bengal assassination. 1943: Famine relief efforts
1905: Key figures in Partition of Bengal protests, important role in Swadeshi movement

mcq.question: Who fought legal battle against child marriage (1872)?
mcq.explanation: Dr. Rakhmabai's legal battle led to Age of Consent Act 1891.

mcq.question: Women of which community participated in 1872 anti-British protests?
mcq.explanation: Women of Kuka Community in Punjab actively participated in protests against British rule.

mcq.question: Who were key figures in 1905 Partition of Bengal protests?
mcq.explanation: Swarnakumari Devi and Sarala Devi Chaudhurani were key figures in Partition protests and Swadeshi movement.

mcq.question: Who led Home Rule League (1916)?
mcq.explanation: Annie Besant led Home Rule League, while Margaret Cousins co-founded Women's Indian Association.

mcq.question: When was Women's Indian Association founded?
mcq.explanation: Women's Indian Association founded 1917 by Annie Besant, Dorothy Jinarajadasa, Margaret Cousins in Madras.

mcq.question: Who participated in 1919 Rowlatt Satyagraha?
mcq.explanation: Kasturba Gandhi and Sarojini Naidu were instrumental in Rowlatt Satyagraha.

mcq.question: First woman arrested in Non-Cooperation Movement (1921)?
mcq.explanation: Basanti Debi was first woman arrested for Non-Cooperation Movement.

mcq.question: Who founded Ahmedabad Textile Labour Association (1925)?
mcq.explanation: Anasuya Sarabhai founded Ahmedabad Textile Labour Association advocating for textile workers' rights.

mcq.question: When was AIWC founded?
mcq.explanation: All India Women's Conference founded 1927, Margaret Cousins was central figure.

mcq.question: First woman legislator who advocated for Sharda Act?
mcq.explanation: Muthulakshmi Reddi, first woman legislator in Chennai's Legislative Council, advocated for Child Marriage Restraint Act 1929.

mcq.question: Who led Dharasana Salt Works raid (1930)?
mcq.explanation: Sarojini Naidu led Dharasana Salt Works raid, Mithuben Petit was prominent participant in Salt Marches.

mcq.question: Who were involved in British magistrate assassination (1930s)?
mcq.explanation: Santi Ghose and Suniti Chaudhuri involved in assassination of British district magistrate, marking women's entry into revolutionary activities.

mcq.question: Who ran secret Congress Radio (1930s-40s)?
mcq.explanation: Usha Mehta ran secret Congress Radio during Civil Disobedience Movement.

mcq.question: Who hoisted Indian flag at Gowalia Tank (1942)?
mcq.explanation: Aruna Asaf Ali hoisted Indian flag at Gowalia Tank during Quit India Movement.

mcq.question: Who became martyr in Quit India Movement (1942)?
mcq.explanation: Matangini Hazra became a martyr during Quit India Movement 1942.

mcq.question: Who worked on famine relief in 1943 Bengal Famine?
mcq.explanation: Kalyani Das and Bina Das played vital roles in 1943 Bengal Famine relief efforts.

mcq.question: Who worked on refugee rehabilitation post-Partition (1947)?
mcq.explanation: Rameshwari Nehru and Mridula Sarabhai focused on refugee rehabilitation and women's welfare after Partition 1947.

comprehensive.question: Trace women's participation in Indian national movement from Early Feminist Movement (1872) through Independence (1947), analyzing their evolving roles from social reform to active revolutionary participation.
comprehensive.answer: Early Phase - Social Reform (1872-1905): 1872 Early Feminist Movement: Dr. Rakhmabai's legal battle against child marriage led to Age of Consent Act 1891, became one of first female doctors. Legal/educational focus.
